words: Lead Balloon” is really good. It’s nothing revolutionary, but in a time when music seems to be getting weirder just for the sake of being weird (and getting accolades even if it doesn’t sound all that great), Carroll is fresh, young, impeccably constructed and a good instance of the dream pop enveloping the Twin Cities right now. Sometimes all you need is a tight ensemble and the know-how in making a lasting melody and you’re set. Carroll have got it.
